means: （对国家、地区、机构等的）管理权

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"管理，支配"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: control, direct, govern, manage, rule, supervise, administer
means: control ： 含义广泛的常用词，指对人或物施以约束或控制的力量。
direct ： 侧重行使领导或指导权。
govern ： 侧重指运用任何控制的权力来统治或管理一个国家、一个社会或一个部门，暗含能力和知识的运用。
manage ： 强调对具体事务机构进行管理，有时含受权管理或处理之意。
rule ： 强调用绝对或独裁的权力来管理或统治。
supervise ： 侧重指运用本身的或被授予的权力来管理、检查工作，含监督意味。
administer ： 指官方的或正式的对事务的管理。

word_mean: 对照：用以评价实验观察的方法，如除有待研究的一种因素缺乏外，其余各方面均与实验观察组完全一致的安排
为达到规定的目标，对元件或系统的工作特性所进行的调节或操作。

sentence.Network_en: The passengers went through immigration control and collected their baggage.
sentence.Network_cn: 旅客通过入境检查后领取了自己的行李。

sentence.Network_en: Condoms are an effective method of birth control if used with care.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果使用得当，避孕套是很有效的避孕手段。

克制;抑制
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb in the sense 'check or verify accounts', especially by referring to a duplicate register): from Anglo-Norman French contreroller 'keep a copy of a roll of accounts', from medieval Latin contrarotulare, from contrarotulus 'copy of a roll', from contra- 'against' + rotulus 'a roll'. The noun is perhaps via French contrôle

entry.tran: (对机构、地方、体系等的)控制权，支配权
entry.def: Control of an organization, place, or system is the power to make all the important decisions about the way that it is run.

example.ex: The restructuring involves Mr Ronson giving up control of the company...
example.tran: 这次改组涉及龙森先生放弃对公司的控制权。

example.ex: The first aim of his government would be to establish control over the republic's territory.
example.tran: 他这届政府的首要目标是确立对共和国领土的控制权。

entry.def: If you have control of something or someone, you are able to make them do what you want them to do.

example.ex: He lost control of his car...
example.tran: 他的汽车失控了。

example.ex: Some teachers have more control over pupils than their parents have.
example.tran: 有的老师比小学生的父母更能管得住他们。

entry.def: If you show control, you prevent yourself behaving in an angry or emotional way.

example.ex: He had a terrible temper, and sometimes he would completely lose control...
example.tran: 他的脾气很坏，有时会完全失控。

example.ex: He was working hard to keep control of himself.
example.tran: 他正努力克制自己。

entry.def: The people who control an organization or place have the power to take all the important decisions about the way that it is run.

example.ex: He now controls the largest retail development empire in southern California...
example.tran: 他现在掌管着加州南部最大的零售发展企业。

example.ex: Almost all of the countries in Latin America were controlled by dictators...
example.tran: 当时几乎所有的拉丁美洲国家都由独裁者统治。

entry.tran: 控制，操纵(设备、过程、系统等)
entry.def: To control a piece of equipment, process, or system means to make it work in the way that you want it to work.

example.ex: ...a computerised system to control the gates...
example.tran: 控制大门的计算机系统

example.ex: Scientists would soon be able to manipulate human genes to control the ageing process.
example.tran: 科学家们很快将能通过操控人类基因来控制衰老过程。

entry.tran: 管制，限定，控制(价格、工资、活动等)
entry.def: When a government controls prices, wages, or the activity of a particular group, it uses its power to restrict them.

example.ex: The federal government tried to control rising health-care costs.
example.tran: 联邦政府试图控制日益高涨的医疗保健费用。

example.ex: ...measures to control illegal mining.
example.tran: 控制非法采矿的措施

entry.def: If you control yourself, or if you control your feelings, voice, or expression, you make yourself behave calmly even though you are feeling angry, excited, or upset.

example.ex: Jo was advised to learn to control herself...
example.tran: 乔得到的建议是要学会控制自己的情绪。

example.ex: I just couldn't control my temper.
example.tran: 我就是不能克制自己的脾气。

entry.def: To control something dangerous means to prevent it from becoming worse or from spreading.

example.ex: ...the need to control environmental pollution...
example.tran: 控制环境污染的需要

example.ex: One of the biggest tasks will be to control the spread of malaria.
example.tran: 最大的任务之一就是控制疟疾的蔓延。

entry.tran: 控制按钮;控制装置;操纵装置
entry.def: A control is a device such as a switch or lever which you use in order to operate a machine or other piece of equipment.

example.ex: I practised operating the controls.
example.tran: 我练习操作这些控制装置。

example.ex: ...the control box.
example.tran: 控制盒

entry.def: Controls are the methods that a government uses to restrict increases, for example in prices, wages, or weapons.

example.ex: Critics question whether price controls would do any good...
example.tran: 评论家们质疑物价管制措施是否会有用。

example.ex: Their talks are expected to focus on arms control...
example.tran: 他们的会谈预计会集中讨论军备控制问题。

entry.def: Control is used to refer to a place where your documents or luggage are officially checked when you enter a foreign country.

example.ex: He went straight through Passport Control without incident.
example.tran: 他很顺利地通过了护照检查处。

example.ex: ...an agreement to abolish border controls.
example.tran: 关于取消边界检查站的一项协议

entry.def: If something is out of control, no-one has any power over it.

example.ex: The fire is burning out of control...
example.tran: 熊熊燃烧的大火正在失去控制。

example.ex: I'm dealing with customers all the time who have let their debts get out of control.
example.tran: 我成天和那些负债累累、无力偿还的顾客们打交道。

entry.def: If something harmful is under control, it is being dealt with successfully and is unlikely to cause any more harm.

example.ex: The situation is under control...
example.tran: 局势已经得到控制。

example.ex: If the current violence is to be brought under control, the government needs to act.
example.tran: 政府必须采取行动，才能使目前的暴力行为得到控制。

means.word_mean: 1. power to direct or determine;
2. a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another;

sentences.sentence: "they instituted controls over drinking on campus"

means.word_mean: 3. (physiology) regulation or maintenance of a function or action or reflex etc;

sentences.sentence: "the timing and control of his movements were unimpaired"
"he had lost control of his sphincters"

means.word_mean: 4. a standard against which other conditions can be compared in a scientific experiment;

sentences.sentence: "the control condition was inappropriate for the conclusions he wished to draw"

means.word_mean: 5. the activity of managing or exerting control over something;

sentences.sentence: "the control of the mob by the police was admirable"

means.word_mean: 6. the state that exists when one person or group has power over another;

sentences.sentence: "her apparent dominance of her husband was really her attempt to make him pay attention to her"

means.word_mean: 7. discipline in personal and social activities;

sentences.sentence: "he was a model of polite restraint"

means.word_mean: 8. great skillfulness and knowledge of some subject or activity;
9. the economic policy of controlling or limiting or curbing prices or wages etc.;

sentences.sentence: "they wanted to repeal all the legislation that imposed economic controls"

means.word_mean: 10. a mechanism that controls the operation of a machine;

sentences.sentence: "the speed control on his turntable was not working properly"
"I turned the controls over to her"

means.word_mean: 11. a spiritual agency that is assumed to assist the medium during a seance
1. exercise authoritative control or power over;
2. lessen the intensity of; temper; hold in restraint; hold or keep within limits;
3. handle and cause to function;

sentences.sentence: "do not operate machinery after imbibing alcohol"

means.word_mean: 4. control (others or oneself) or influence skillfully, usually to one's advantage;

sentences.sentence: "She is a very controlling mother and doesn't let her children grow up"
"The teacher knew how to keep the class in line"

means.word_mean: 5. verify or regulate by conducting a parallel experiment or comparing with another standard, of scientific experiments;
6. verify by using a duplicate register for comparison;
7. be careful or certain to do something; make certain of something;

sentences.sentence: "He verified that the valves were closed"

means.word_mean: 8. have a firm understanding or knowledge of; be on top of;

auth_sentence.content: But it never feels out of control or flabby.
auth_sentence.res_content: But it never feels out of control or flabby.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But it never feels out of control or flabby.

auth_sentence.content: We got out-enthused and didn't control the game.
auth_sentence.res_content: We got out-enthused and didn't control the game.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We got out-enthused and didn't control the game.

auth_sentence.content: The first opportunity we see is in remote control.
auth_sentence.res_content: The first opportunity we see is in remote control.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The first opportunity we see is in remote control.

roll轮子,转,滚→v.滚动；摇晃；碾；卷 n.卷；名册

Sentence.sentence: Human control of fire goes back far enough (over a million years) that evolution could have produced a genetic leaning towards fire as a central aspect of human life.
So here's a suggestion offered by two researchers at the Rand Corporation: Why not take a lesson from alcohol control policies and apply them to where food is sold and how it's displayed?

Many policy measures to control obesity（肥胖症）assume that people consciously and rationally choose what and how much they eat and therefore focus on providing information and more access to healthier foods," note the two researchers
Because so many of our modern technologies and services depend on oil, nations, corporations, and institutions that control the trade in oil exercise extraordinary power.
It's the message you sent me about the delivery delay of the control desks.
Those control desks are a special order

means.word_mean: 控制, 抑制, 支配

sentences.en: I couldn't control myself, and I hit him.
sentences.cn: 我气得不得了就打了他。

sentences.en: A captain controls his ship and its crew.
sentences.cn: 船长管理他的船和船上的船员。

means.word_mean: 克制，约束

sentences.en: He controlled his anger and left the school.
sentences.cn: 他压住怒火离开了学校。

means.word_mean: 核实；验证；检查

sentences.en: The accounts of the whole company are controlled in this department.
sentences.cn: 整个公司的账目都是由这个部门检查。

管理手段

sentences.en: She explained the controls of the washing machine.
sentences.cn: 她解释了这台洗衣机的控制系统。

jushi.english: The accounts of the whole company are controlled in this department.
jushi.chinese: 整个公司的账目都在这个部门接受检查。

jushi.english: At that time the Romans controlled a vast empire.
jushi.chinese: 那时,罗马人统治着一个很大的帝国。

jushi.english: A captain controls his ship and its crew.
jushi.chinese: 船长管理他的船和船上的船员。
